sense.name: line up or make parallel; bring into proper adjustment
sense.examples: Align the baseline of the box with the baseline of the parent box. The research team also aligned the nanotubes. Can you align the wheels of my car? Align your compass with north.

sense.name: bring into concord
sense.examples: We need to align our strategies. Where can we find classroom resources aligned with state standards? Is your sales compensation plan aligned with the times?

sense.name: associate with; join together
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent[human]] ALIGN (ONESELF) WITH NP2[theme[human]] NP1[agent[human]] ALIGN (PP) NOTE: this can include groups made up of human entities like companies, movements, parties etc.
sense.examples: He aligned himself purposely with Hillary Clinton. Mark aligned himself with the industrialists. Bush and Karzai say they are aligned against the Taliban.
